required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Marine Protein Hydrolysate as Dietary Supplement in Elderly Part I
clinical_study.official_title: A Study of the Effects of Marine Protein Hydrolysate as Dietary Supplement on the Regulation of Postprandial Blood Glucose Metabolism in Healthy Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to investigate the potential effect of a marine protein hydrolysate (MPH) supplement before a meal on postprandial glucose tolerance in healthy subjects, to achieve more knowledge on this presumed beneficial, blood glucose lowering effect

detailed_description.textblock: To further investigate the effects of MPH in a single dose of 20 mg/kg of body weight on postprandial blood glucose, insulin and GLP-1 (as markers of glucose metabolism) in healthy, active middle-aged to elderly subjects - age 40-65 years.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: A double-blind crossover trial, including two different study days, with 4-7 days wash-out (WO) period in between. The intervention implemented 20 mg of MPH per kg body weight (test material) or control (casein).

primary_outcome.time_frame: First sample fasting baseline, thereafter repeated samples every 20 minutes (i.e.20, 40, 60, 80, 100,120,140 minutes after baseline), last at 200 minutes after baseline.
primary_outcome.description: Postprandial glucose (mmol/L) change on each day of intervention

secondary_outcome.time_frame: First sample fasting baseline, thereafter repeated samples every 20 minutes (i.e.20, 40, 60, 80, 100,120,140 minutes after baseline), last at 200 minutes after baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Postprandial Insulin (mIE/L) - change on each day of intervention

secondary_outcome.time_frame: First sample fasting baseline, thereafter repeated samples (i.e.20, 40, 60, 100 minutes after baseline), last at 200 minutes after baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Glucagon like peptide 1 (GLP-1) pmol/l change on each day of intervention

secondary_outcome.time_frame: First (baseline) symptomscore (as described above) measured fasting , thereafter repeated symptom score i.e. at 20, 40 minutes after baseline, last symptom score measure at 200 minutes after baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed by questionnaire VAS, scale from 0-10, where 0 is minimum score and 10 is the maximum score, reported e.g. as a total score of 7. The higher the reported value is the worse outcome.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: First (baseline) symptom score (as described above) measured fasting and the next measure at 200 minutes after baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed by questionaire KANE (family name) , scale from 0-10, where 0 is minimum score and 10 is the maximum score, reported e.g. as a total score of 7. The higher the reported value is the worse outcome.

arm_group.description: 20 mg powder per kg body weight of Marine protein hydrolysate (MPH)
20 mg powder per kg body weight of casein/maltodextrin

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Signed informed consent
- Body mass index (BMI) 20-30
Exclusion Criteria:
- Suspected allergies against fish or shellfish
- Low or unstable blood pressure
- Diabetes mellitus, treated pharmacological
- Chronic diseases or therapies that is likely to interfere with the evaluation of study results
- Acute infections (may be reconsidered for inclusion at a later time)
- Allergic to milk, confirmed diagnose
- Pregnancy
- Women who are breast-feeding infants
- Inability or unwillingness to comply with the requirements of study procedures

overall_official.last_name: Dag Arne Lihaug Hoff, MD, PhD
overall_official.affiliation: Møre & Romsdal Hospital Trust, Ålesund Hospital

facility.name: Ålesund Hospital, Helse Møre og Romsdal HF
